oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Solution for Coupled Vibrations of Short and Long Circular Shafts/Beams with Two Arbitrarily Oriented Open Cracks
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NAIK, SS
MAITI, SK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Analysis of shafts/beams with cracks
Multiple cracks
Cracks in arbitrary orientations in shafts
Natural vibrations of circular beams with cracks
Coupled vibrations of circular shafts/beams
MULTIPLE CRACKS
NATURAL FREQUENCIES
BEAMS
IDENTIFICATION
ROTOR
TIMOSHENKO
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper deals with analytical solution of coupled free vibration of both Timoshenko (or short) and Euler-Bernoulli (or long/slender) circular shafts/beams in the presence of two open edge cracks with straight fronts lying on two cross-sections separated by a distance and orientated arbitrarily with respect to each other. The local effects of cracks on natural vibrations have been represented through the compliance approach in the modeling. The compliance coefficients in terms of crack orientation obtained through the concept of linear elastic fracture mechanics (LEFM) are employed. Solutions for free vibration problems are presented for both long and short beams. The analytical results are compared with FE results. The agreement is very good.
